product_name: ConairInfinitiPRO By Conair Luxe Series Full Body & Shine Pro Dryer
summary: SummaryINFINITI PRO CONAIR Luxe Series Full Body & Shine Pro Dryer boosts volume and shine with less frizz for smooth, salon-worthy styles.
details: DetailsBenefitsPowerful airflow for big volume boost with up to 50% faster drying with a professional AC motor that lasts up to 3x longer than ConairÂ® standard motor hair dryers.Infrared heat generated with titanium technology dries gently and evenly.Customize your style with 6 heat and speed settings and then lock it in with the true cold shot button.Specially-designed no-slip handle ensures a soft, comfortable finish.FeaturesReduce flyaways with ionic technology that cuts frizz by up to 75%, when compared to hair dryers with natural ion generation.IncludesConcentrator attachment focuses airflow as you dry for smoother, straighter, sleeker results.Professional diffuser boosts natural body and adds fullness. And blowout brush makes it easy to style and smooth.Item 2562009

reviews.comments: Really helps with taming my frizz when I don't want to wear my hair wavy/curly the different settings are perfect for preventing damage

reviews.headline: I like this product
reviews.comments: Been using for about 3 years already, pretty easy to use and like the attachment that comes with it.

reviews.headline: decent and affordable
reviews.comments: I don't do much with my hair. I like to blow dry it straight- and that's about it. my old dryer from 2006 (lol) wasn't cutting it anymore, so I upgraded to this. it's obviously a lot more powerful than what I was using. I like all the things you get with it! the back piece (where the air sucks in) falls off anytime I put the dryer away. since it doesn't fall off WHILE I'm using it, I don't mind *too* much. just be careful not to lose it while storing!

reviews.headline: Great dryer
reviews.comments: This dryer has great power!

reviews.headline: I would not buy this product again
reviews.comments: The dyer doesn't dry very well as the heat is only cool or warm.

reviews.headline: Not worth the money
reviews.comments: Not a good hair dryer. Gets hot for a couple of minutes and just cools off. It rats up my hair so bad also and I have more frizz after I use it.

reviews.headline: Returning
reviews.comments: Its really pretty looking and looked like it had good reviews, but I was unfortunately not impressed. It did not get hot at all and it blows way too strong. I will be returning.

reviews.headline: I would buy again!!
reviews.comments: Yes, I would buy again

reviews.headline: Not the best, not the worst
reviews.comments:
Ive had this hair dryer for a while now and as my review title states, its not terrible, but its not amazing. 

Pros: very strong air flow, quick drying, gets hot 

Cons: tangles the HECK out of your hair because the airflow is poorly controlled, is extremely loud 

Overall, this is a good dryer if you want something that will get your hair dried fast. However, that crazy powerful airflow can cause a lot of knots and tangles especially if you are rough drying. It is also very loud so if you have sensitive ears, tinnitus, etc. this is probably not the best option.

reviews.headline: So cute!
reviews.comments: The color attracted me but the features led me to buy this cute blowdryer. So far, it is working well with the diffuser.

reviews.headline: Dissapointing
reviews.comments: My old compact hair dryer stopped working and I was in a need of a new hair dryer. The selection of  compact hair dryers in the store was very poor so I picked this InfinitiPRO By Conair Luxe Series Full Body & Shine Pro Dryer even though it was too big for my liking. Me and my two guests used it and we all ended up with knotted hair due to the chaotic air flow. It was also too loud and bulky to style my own hair so I returned it.

reviews.headline: I'm new to using a blow dryer..
reviews.comments: I usually keep my hair in a towel and wait for it to dry fully while I sleep. I am so much more confident with my hair because this dryer is versatile and had helpful "get to know your dryer" videos and how to's when styling.

reviews.headline: Great replacement for my old dryer
reviews.comments: My old dryer broke and I was happy to find this reasonably-priced dryer at Ulta. It is relatively lightweight and the variable settings work well for me.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Works great on my fine, thin, straight hair. I love it.

reviews.headline: great hair dryer but the material is sticky
reviews.comments: I absolutely loved this hair dryer speed and heat. I had long hair and thick hair for two years and this was mine and my roommate's Go-To hair dryer for a long time, but we had a major issue with it that made us give up. the material of the hair dryer is like silicone and everything gets stuck to it, hair, lint, everything will attach to it like an adhesive. it's a pain to clean and if it was made out of a different material it would be perfect.

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: Worked perfectly

reviews.headline: Smallest one I could find
reviews.comments: This was still heavier than the last Conair I got.  It's nicely compact and a pretty color but I don't understand why it's heavy.  (The brush included is waaaay too big for my short fine hair.)

reviews.headline: Don't waste your time
reviews.comments: I had to get a dryer bc my Bed Head one that I love is on its way out. I woujd have loved to get another but unfortunately they don't make it anymore. My budget was open but I really didn't want to spend over $150. I ended up with this one bc of the brand, and let's be honest, its pretty. Unfortunately it does not deliver. The airflow is really intense but it never got hot; it was seriously luke warm at best. Plus, it's insanely loud!! Sorry but its going back. I'll be testing them all before i buy.

reviews.headline: overall heavy device
reviews.comments: Dryer does good job of drying hair and making smooth but is very heavy.

reviews.headline: I'm returning this item
reviews.comments:
Too heavy, loud, fingers hit unwanted buttons while blowing also too large for me 
I don't need the accessories either 
I'd recommend this for a larger woman with very thick hair that's hard to dry hair because of it's power

faceoff_positive.comments:
I previously had a super cheap hair dryer with no attachments. The Conair Luxe Pro dryer is so much better! The tip is pretty narrow, which lets you direct the air exactly where you want it  to go and with the concentrator attachment you can do an at-home blowout! The cold shot makes quite cool air, which both helps set a blow-out but also just feels very refreshing after all the hot air of drying. This dryer gets super hot on the hot setting so I used the hot setting at first when the sections of hair were quite damp but then I switched to the medium setting to avoid heat damage. 

If I use the concentrator attachment and the included round brush, my hair gets super smooth and frizz-free! I attached a picture so you can see the smoothing effect of the dryer. 

Note: I have tried to do a blowout by following a YouTube tutorial but I had never done one before and I kept having to turn the dryer off to position the round brush so I think my hair kept both cooling down too much, and also I could not figure out the wrist motions to use the brush to give a curl. So my hair ended up just blowing it out straightâ€” but with a super smooth finish! I think that with more practice of if you are someone that actually knows how to do your own blow out, this hair dryer will give a nice blowout: it definitely gets hot enough and already makes my hair smooth even without knowing what I'm doing. 

I had not owned a round bristle-brush before the one that comes with this dryer (and is matching purple!) so I can't compare it to anything, but it seems like it works well in terms of holding your hair in place so that you can use the concentrator attachment to smooth your hair. (If you don't know how to position the hair dryer to get the smoothing effect, I watched a Brad Mondo blowout tutorial on YouTube). 

I do not have curly hair, but my roommate does and she keeps borrowing this hair dryer to use the diffuser attachment. She has short hair so I can't speak to how it would work on longer curly hair, but on her short curly hair it makes the curls tighter and more defined. (Although her hair does not turn out as smooth using the diffuser as mine does with the concentratorâ€” but this might be a user learning-curve)

In summary this dryer feels more powerful than my old basic hair-dryer: it gets hotter and the cold shot gets cooler. Having a hair dryer with a concentrator attachment and a round brush has been awesome for me, and the diffuser has been great for my roommate. The 2 drawbacks I are that the brush is kind of big (although I have a pretty small head) and the hair dryer is a bit heavy. I should also note that I received this hair dryer for free in exchange for an unbiased review/ but the attached picture will show you directly how well it works! Although, I will also note that I have also tried the Conair Dr. Knot Smoothing All-in-one Dryer brush, and if you are just going for a smooth straight blowout look, the all-in-one dryer brush is much easier to use and gives pretty similar results. My eventual hope for THIS hair dryer is that if I practice more I will be able to get a fancy voluminous/loose curl blowout look. So I think this hair dryer is more flexibleâ€” you can do any type of blowout finish. But it is harder to use since you have to coordinate the brush in one hand with the dryer in another (which apparently is hard for me, haha.)
faceoff_positive.headline: Very smoothing & frizz-removing!

faceoff_negative.comments: i really hate to say this, but this product does not work well on doing blowouts and styling. If you want a bombshell blowout, this won't work for you unless you don't mind having to go back and waste time applying more heat with a straighter or curling iron since this blow dryer could not do all that for you. I'm not new to giving myself a blowout.  if you want something super basic, the price tag isn't worth it. This is solely to just try and literally just dry your hair out. As hot to the touch this blow dryer  can get, you'd think my hair wouldn't still be damp after several swipes with the round brush, but it sure was and it made some parts look fried even with the best of the best on my heat protectant (i use sebastian spray)  and serums. It brought back memories in the 2000s as a kid being in a salon and coming out with poofy frizzed up mess for the whole world to see since nobody knew how to really blowout hair then with it being all about the flat iron. it didn't matter how small of a section i take or how good my round brush is- it just still felt a little damp. it made my hair look a little fried and frizzy. i'll be returning it. Maybe for "thin" hair, it's great, but if you have thick color treated hair- this won't work for you at all. It's a shame, because the more expensive blow dryers don't always last long. This one i'm told does...
faceoff_negative.headline: too pricy for a basic blow dryer
